messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: brasil
messages.msgSnippet: How about talking about something sword related for a change huh ????? Richard
messages.messageBody:
How about talking about something sword related for a change huh ?????

Richard

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: brasil
messages.msgSnippet: geez................ do I have to explain my jokes in every single sword message board ? Even Ms Palin read the Economists for heaven s sake. (
messages.messageBody:
geez................ do I have to explain my jokes in every single sword
message board ?

Even Ms Palin read the Economists for heaven's sake. ( hint.......another
joke )

Thanks, John.


Milt


In a message dated 10/29/2008 4:45:59 P.M. Central Daylight Time,
excelsiorilluminati@... writes:




Just Milt's humour, I'm sure. Shining path 'sendosa illuminosa' a
Marxist guerilla group in Peru. John

Just Milt's humour, I'm sure. Shining path 'sendosa illuminosa' a
Marxist guerilla group in Peru. John

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: brasil
messages.msgSnippet: wat do you mean by the shining path? and peru?????????????? christophe ... From: MuramasaIII@aol.com To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com Sent: Wednesday, October
messages.messageBody:
wat do you mean by the shining path?
and peru??????????????

christophe
----- Original Message -----
From: MuramasaIII@...
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, October 29, 2008 3:26 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: brasil


might as well try Peru too............but don't step on the " shining path "
though.

milt


In a message dated 10/28/2008 3:40:39 P.M. Central Daylight Time,
sigp210@... writes:

Sao Paolo has a million-strong Japanese community, the largest outside
Japan. I am sure there must be swords and collectors there if there
are that many Japanese people.
Liberdade is the Japanese district in São Paulo.
I would try and see if there are any forums or groups based there that
you can contact.

Brian

--- In _nihontostudy@nihontostudynih_ (mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com) ,
"excelsiorilluminat,
<excelsiorilluminatexcel> wrote:
>
> I am sure there are collectors there. This being an English speaking
> forum we get people who are comfortable with English and there are
> members from the southern hemisphere. There would be more who do not
> speak English and those not even aware of this forum. How many? Do
> not know. How much work would be available. How big of a group would
> need it? Surely not enough to be a full time occupation. What is your
> name? Maybe some of us know of your work in Nederland. John
>
>
> --- In _nihontostudy@nihontostudynih_ (mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com)
, Polijster <polijster@> wrote:
> >
> > ok you win ............ ok you w ok you win

> > why so much trouble for nothing
> > ----- Original Message -----

> >

> > dialects of one language.
> >

messages.subject: Re: brasil
messages.msgSnippet: Sao Paolo has a million-strong Japanese community, the largest outside Japan. I am sure there must be swords and collectors there if there are that many
messages.messageBody:
Sao Paolo has a million-strong Japanese community, the largest outside
Japan. I am sure there must be swords and collectors there if there
are that many Japanese people.
Liberdade is the Japanese district in São Paulo.
I would try and see if there are any forums or groups based there that
you can contact.

Brian

messages.subject: Re: brasil
messages.msgSnippet: I am sure there are collectors there. This being an English speaking forum we get people who are comfortable with English and there are members from the
messages.messageBody:
I am sure there are collectors there. This being an English speaking
forum we get people who are comfortable with English and there are
members from the southern hemisphere. There would be more who do not
speak English and those not even aware of this forum. How many? Do
not know. How much work would be available. How big of a group would
need it? Surely not enough to be a full time occupation. What is your
name? Maybe some of us know of your work in Nederland. John

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] brasil
messages.msgSnippet: geez, you mean to tell me  Latin America don t speak Latin ? milt In a message dated 10/26/2008 11:19:21 A.M. Central Daylight Time, apedraza93@gmail.com
messages.messageBody:
geez, you mean to tell me Latin America don't speak Latin ?


milt


In a message dated 10/26/2008 11:19:21 A.M. Central Daylight Time,
apedraza93@... writes:




Yes. My point was, the language is called Portuguese, not Brazilian,
even if there are idiomatic differences between the Portugal and
Brazil versions. It's like Spanish. Single language. There's no
Mexican, Colombian, Cuban, etc. Just regional differences and
dialects of one language.

Best,

Andy (who's been in Brazil)

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] brasil
messages.msgSnippet: ok you win ............................happy now strange, this is not a answer on my first question why so much trouble for nothing ... From: Andres Pedraza
messages.messageBody:
ok you win ............................happy now
strange, this is not a answer on my first question
why so much trouble for nothing
----- Original Message -----
From: Andres Pedraza
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, October 26, 2008 5:18 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] brasil


Yes. My point was, the language is called Portuguese, not Brazilian,
even if there are idiomatic differences between the Portugal and
Brazil versions. It's like Spanish. Single language. There's no
Mexican, Colombian, Cuban, etc. Just regional differences and
dialects of one language.

Best,

Andy (who's been in Brazil)

messages.subject: brasil
messages.msgSnippet: hello fellow members, i have had this crazy idear, i want to move from holland to brasil i want to polish swords there. wich i do for 25 years now i want to
messages.messageBody:
hello fellow members,

i have had this crazy idear, i want to move from holland to brasil
i want to polish swords there.
wich i do for 25 years now
i want to know if there are any swords and collectors in brasil.
and are they waiting for me?
the answer can also be given in brasilian

hope to hear from one of you in a short wile.

best regards
siliacus
